content.question: A parallel plate capacitor with air between the plates is charged and then disconnected from the source of emf. If the space between the plates is now filled with a dielectric, what happens to the capacitance of the capacitor and the magnitude of the electric field between the plates?

choices.label: Capacitance Magnitude of the Electric Field Increases Increases
Capacitance Magnitude of the Electric Field Increases Remains constant
Capacitance Magnitude of the Electric Field Increases Decreases
Capacitance Magnitude of the Electric Field Decreases Increases
Capacitance Magnitude of the Electric Field Decreases Decreases

content.answer: Capacitance Magnitude of the Electric Field Increases Decreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
